channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN

item.title: Report E-2024070677
item.description:
Report E-2024070677

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: VINCENNES
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of AMERLOCK 600 LIGHT TINT BASE released from (10) 1-gallon metal cans due to improper loading (came in with a 1,000-pound skid on top of it). The release was contained to the cardboard boxes and nothing impacted the trailer floor. Terminal personnel had already completely cleaned and containerized the spill into a metal drum prior to ERTS notification.

item.title: Report E-2024070653
item.description:
Report E-2024070653

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-04
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to be crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the spent absorbents and damaged pail into two (2) 5-gallon poly pails. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024070551

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: FORT WAYNE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 3-ounces of UN0336 Fireworks released impacting the trailer floor. The cause was due to a forklift accident. ERTS reviewed the SDS with terminal personnel who feel comfortable cleaning the release with the proper PPE available on site.
